actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Oversight.

official_title: To amend the National Voter Registration Act of 1993 to require each individual registering to vote in elections for Federal office to provide the individual's Social Security number and to permit a State to remove a registrant who fails to vote in two consecutive general elections for Federal office from the official list of eligible voters in elections for Federal office on the ground that the registrant has changed residence, if the registrant fails to respond to written notices requesting confirmation of the registrant's residence.
short_title: Integrity in Voter Registration Act of 1996

summary.text: Integrity in Voter Registration Act of 1996 - Amends the National Voter Registration Act of 1993 to require applicants registering to vote in elections for Federal office to provide their social security number. Authorizes a State to remove the name of a registrant from the official list of eligible voters in elections for Federal office on the grounds that the registrant has changed residence if the registrant has not: (1) voted in an election during the period beginning on the day after the date of the second previous general Federal election held prior to being sent a specified notice; (2) voted in any of the first two general Federal elections after being sent a notice; and (3) responded to such notices.

titles.title: Integrity in Voter Registration Act of 1996

To amend the National Voter Registration Act of 1993 to require each individual registering to vote in elections for Federal office to provide the individual's Social Security number and to permit a State to remove a registrant who fails to vote in two consecutive general elections for Federal office from the official list of eligible voters in elections for Federal office on the ground that the registrant has changed residence, if the registrant fails to respond to written notices requesting confirmation of the registrant's residence.
